divs: Sighting DetailsAfter doing a normal nightly scan of the sky, I noticed a strange odd pentagon-like shaped star constellation in the sky I have never seen before. Upon saying this outloud to myself, a star just outside the pentagon-like constellation began moving. Obviously stars dont move, but here in Alaska, I have been watching them for some 12 years off and on now, but this is the first one I have caught in quite some time. It lasted longer than most "moving stars," as most sightings the objects are moving much faster and out-of-sight within two or three minutes. This object began in the SW sky and traveled NNW for over four minutes before fading out of view. It was a light white and slightly orange in color. It did not shift from its slow straight path, but was not a satellite either. I would have to say if it was in our planets orbit it must have been at around 60-70+ thousand feet high. NOTE: My wife reported a UFO for the first time in her life only back in January, in which the following night a strange "blackout" happened in which my wife and I either both had the same dream, or she had an abduction. {Ironically, when my dad's mom was 5 months old, he was in the car with my grandmother and grandfather, and my grandmother was abducted in Orange County, California in the spring of 1953. I was the first grandson of 7 sisters and brothers, and our son was 9 months old when the "possible" abduction of my wife took place.}
trends: There have been 5 other sightings in Soldotna
There was one other sighting in Soldotna on or around March 2nd 2011
Summary: Star like moving object at 60-70+ thousand feet
